meaningMnemonic: The <radical>dirt</radical> on the <radical>forehead</radical> of a <radical>pig</radical> makes a small <kanji>mound</kanji>. Picture it, if you will. A pig is rooting through the dirt. It lifts its head and there is a mound of dirt right on its forehead.
readingMnemonic: The pig's forehead dirt <kanji>mound</kanji> keeps getting bigger until it's the size of <reading>two cars</reading> (つか)! Pigs are big, but you didn't think one could balance a mound the size of two cars on its forehead and not fall over.
